shared_text:
Mountain Range High School
September 11 at 5:03 PM ¬∑

Today, on September 11th please take a moment to pause and remember the 2,997 people who lost their lives on this day in 2001.

Commemorating the 19th anniversary of the 9/11 attacks on the United States, 412 American flags were placed in the flower bed of in front of the City of Westminster Public Safety Center. The 412 flags represent the 343 firemen, 60 police officers, and 8 paramedics who lost their lives rescuing victims of the attacks. Thank you to first responders across the country for serving our communities.

This tribute was made possible by Mountain Range Class of 2022 Junior Class Leadership and Mountain Range Student Government.

post_text: Today we celebrated as our contractor Adolfson & Peterson Construction turned over the keys to our second career and technical education campus, FutureForward at Washington Square. This new campus will expand career training opportunities for high school students across our district. Washington Square is a new home for our construction trades and welding programs and offers new programs such as crime scene investigation and fire science programs as well as an advanced diesel mechanic program. Thank you to the Five Star Community for making this new campus possible through their support of the #FiveStarBond. We continue to develop plans to offer high school students some in-person CTE opportunities even during this time of remote learning. We're also looking forward to an opportunity in the future to officially celebrate the completion of this beautiful new building with the Five Star Community.

post_text: COVID-19 Update: District to start remote learning for students on April 1 through at least April 17. The Governor announced this evening, Wednesday, March 18, that schools should plan on remote learning through at least April 17. Given this, the district will begin remote learning and modified operations starting the week of March 30 with students starting remote learning on April 1. We know this is uncharted territory and recognize families will be in different places in their ability to focus time on remote learning based on life factors, family matters and internet/device accessibility. With this in mind, our goal is to design a remote learning plan that allows families and students to complete assignments throughout the day at times that work best for them and continue to provide the best learning opportunities possible. #FiveStarProud #DoingMyPartCO For more information, including device requests, read the full update on our website: www.adams12.org/COVID19-Updates
